meanings.definition: A person who carries a basket on their head.
meanings.sent1: The canephor balanced the basket skillfully on their head.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, a canephor is a common sight carrying goods.
meanings.sent3: The canephor accidentally dropped the basket, causing a comical scene.
meanings.sent4: She moved gracefully, like a canephor carrying a basket of flowers.
meanings.sent5: The image of the canephor with the basket on her head stayed in my mind.

meanings.definition: A decorative architectural element in the form of a basket or vase.
meanings.sent1: The building's design included a canephor as a unique ornament.
meanings.sent2: The canephor on the pillar added an elegant touch to the structure.
meanings.sent3: The canephor detail on the building made it stand out from the rest.
meanings.sent4: The canephor seemed to hold the weight of the entire structure on its shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The canephor design was intricate and eye-catching, drawing attention to the building.

meanings.definition: A type of ancient Greek statue depicting a woman carrying a basket on her head.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed a beautiful canephor statue from ancient Greece.
meanings.sent2: Visitors admired the craftsmanship of the canephor sculpture in the exhibit.
meanings.sent3: The canephor statue seemed to be whispering secrets to the other artworks.
meanings.sent4: The canephor figure stood tall, symbolizing strength and grace.
meanings.sent5: The canephor statue captured the essence of ancient Greek artistry.
